The magnitude of the Ampère force on either segment is F₀ = I L B.
Let the z-axis point out of the page.
For AB: F₁ lies in the plane of the paper and points downwards and to the left; For BC: F₂ points downwards and to the right.
The two forces are symmetric with respect to the vertical dashed line; their horizontal components are opposite, while their vertical components are equal in magnitude and both directed downward.
The angle between AB and BC is 120°, so each segment makes an angle of 60° with the vertical dashed line.
The vertical component of the force on either segment is |F_vertical| = (I L B)(√3/2).
The horizontal components cancel, the two vertical components add to F_net = √3 I L B.
The net force is directed vertically downward along the dashed symmetry line.
Magnitude of the Ampère force on the entire wire ABC is F = √3 I L B, directed vertically downward.
